title: Structured Handover Tools
content: Structured handover formats (SBAR, I-PASS, IMSAFE) ensure consistent information transfer. They prevent reliance on memory and reduce individual variation. The structure itself prompts coverage of essential elements.

scenario.story: Two teams use different handover approaches. Team A uses a structured checklist covering status, concerns, pending tasks, and anticipated issues. Team B relies on experienced operators giving verbal summaries. After a shift change, Team B misses that a critical part is on order and continues operations assuming full capability.

options.A: Team B needs more experienced operators
options.B: Structured handovers would have prompted coverage of pending items
options.C: Team A's approach is too rigid

scenario.explanation: Structure compensates for human memory limitations and variation. Experienced operators forget things too. The checklist prompt 'pending items/orders' would have surfaced the part issue regardless of who conducted the handover.
